title: MMR-Mamba: Multi-Contrast MRI Reconstruction with Mamba and Spatial-Frequency Information Fusion
details: J Zou, L Liu, Q Chen, S Wang, X Xing, J Qin - arXiv preprint arXiv:2406.18950, 2024
abstract: Multi-contrast MRI acceleration has become prevalent in MR imaging, enabling the reconstruction of high-quality MR images from under-sampled k-space data of the target modality, using guidance from a fully-sampled auxiliary modality. The main …

title: Detection of Landmarks in X-Ray Images Through Deep Learning
details: M Fernandes, V Filipe, A Sousa, L Gonçalves - … 2023, Vila Real, Portugal, November 29–30 …
abstract: This paper presents a study on the automated detection of landmarks in medical x- ray images using deep learning techniques. In this work we developed two neural networks based on semantic segmentation to automatically detect landmarks in x-ray …

title: Improving radiology report generation with multi-grained abnormality prediction
details: Y Jin, W Chen, Y Tian, Y Song, C Yan - Neurocomputing, 2024
abstract: Conventional data-driven approaches for radiology report generation face a problem that the descriptions of the normal regions in the real data are much more than the that for abnormal ones, which potentially leads to the bias of losing focus on …
